data.title: slint/logo/README.md at master · slint-ui/slint
data.meta_description: Slint is a declarative GUI toolkit to build native user interfaces for Rust, C++, or JavaScript apps. - slint/logo/README.md at master · slint-ui/slint
data.text:
This directory contains the different versions of the Slint logo. It is (manually) copied into the website under https://slint.dev/logo/.

Do not modify the logo by changing the colors, changing of the aspect ration, or other alterations to the corporate identity.

When using the logo to refer to Slint from a location not dedicated to Slint, use the full versions of the logo with the full tagline ("GUI toolkit").

When using the logo to refer to Slint for illustrative purposes, from a place where the viewer is expected to already know about Slint (e.g. because it is on the Slint website itself) use the simple versions of the logo.

For the cases where a square or circular logo is required (e.g. social media avatar), the square versions of the logo can be used. Prefer the version with the text.

For a small icon where the text would not be visible otherwise, use the square versions of the logo without the text.

Use the #MadeWithSlint logo for attributions to Slint (e.g. when using Slint under the Royalty-Free License).

For Dark mode/backgrounds, use the versions with dark.

For Light mode/backgrounds, use the versions with light.

If the background switched between dark and light mode, but only one logo can be shown, use the versions with whitebg.

The Slint blue color is:

For Screen: #2379F4 (Hex), R=35 G=121 B=244, Tint = 100,

For Print: CMYK = 75,45,0,0,

For Spot Color (Pantone): PMS 2727 C.

The name of the product is Slint, not Slint UI.

slint-ui or slint_ui is used as username for online service when (and only when) slint is already taken.

The company (legal entity) behind Slint is SixtyFPS GmbH. That name should only be used to refer to the company, including the GmbH. (SixtyFPS was the former name of the product but should no longer be used.) Employees of SixtyFPS GmbH should still use the name Slint whenever possible (e.g. on conference badges).
